snippet: Exports plunged 3.6 percent and imports were low, the Commerce Department reported.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that nation's trade deficit widened 4.9 percent in October to $42.2 billion as exports suffered biggest decline in nearly four years, indicating that slowing global demand is spilling over into nation's already struggling economy.
lead_paragraph: Exports plunged 3.6 percent and imports were low, the Commerce Department reported.

headline.seo: Slowing Global Demand Widens Trade Deficit
headline.main: Slowing Demand Widened U.S. Trade Deficit in October
headline.print_headline: Slowing Demand Widened U.S. Trade Deficit in October
